item.title: Application Whitelist Bypass using IEexec.exe
item.description: Guest post by @subTee There was a recent presentation at DerbyCon, entitled: Living Off the Land: A Minimalistâ€™s Guide to Windows Post-Exploitation by Christopher Campbell & Matthew Graeber I highly recommend that you start with this presentation as it lays the foundation for this post. The premise is, how can we maintain persistence in a corporate environment, using tools and defaults provided by the host OS we have compromised. This is a very important concept, given the shift in many organizations to an Application Whitelisting Defense model.
